c74object.name: bessel
c74object.description: Calculate Bessel functions, based on parameterization of said functions. An X input will cause a corresponding Y output out the outlet. Read more about bessel functions here.

method.name: j0
method.description: 0th integer order. Modify the gain of `a` when `a` is equivalent to zero. j0 refers to zeros of the bessel function of the first kind. This function is particularly relevant to spherical calculations. See more here.

method.name: jmn
method.description: Bessel functions of the second kind, defined as solutions to the bessel differential equation. These equations have two linearly independent variables, hence the 'm' and 'n'. See more here.

method.name: jn
method.description: Bessel functions of the first kind, defined as solutions to the bessel differential equation. These equations are non-singular at the origin, and are particuarly relevant to cylindrical harmonics. See more here.

method.name: float
method.description: A float input will output the corresponding Y value(s) along the X axis of the transfer function. This output can be a list, depending on the type of Bessel function defined.

entry.name: Inlet 1 [anything]
entry.description: The first inlet of bdist accepts a number of types of messages. Refer to the list above.

entry.name: Outlet 1 [list or float]
entry.description:
This output is variable, and can be one of the following:
- Y output from corresponding X input
- A list of chosen values from the distribution designated in the left inlet
- A float that represents a chosen value from either a bang in the left inlet, or a when the object receives the message [distlist 1]
